lines.text: Phaedra... please, help me... let me go.
These people are like gods. They celebrate with fire in the sky.
I don't call you "mother," do I?
If you do, I'll kill you.
Didn't your father teach you *any* Greek?
No. Mother wouldn't let him. She thinks all Greeks are savages.

[to Ercy]
Little cousin, you don't own me. Why does everybody think they own me? *Nobody* owns me!

[Ercy is dabbing some of Phaedra's perfume on herself, thinking it will help her be attractive to Alexis]
Don't touch my perfume! I don't like my perfume on other people.

[to Alexis, after Phaedra has told him the truth about her affair with Alexis]
My whole life... my whole life, you make my whole life DIRTY!
